title: Patient Activity Scale (PAS) for RA
desc: The Patient Activity Scale (PAS) for RA quantifies severity of rheumatoid arthritis (RA) using patient-reported symptoms.

orgreference.text: Wolfe F, Michaud K, Pincus T. A composite disease activity scale for clinical practice, observational studies, and clinical trials: the patient activity scale (PAS/PAS-II). J Rheumatol. 2005;32(12):2410-5.

other_refer.text: Anderson J, Caplan L, Yazdany J, et al. Rheumatoid arthritis disease activity measures: American College of Rheumatology recommendations for use in clinical practice. Arthritis Care Res (Hoboken). 2012;64(5):640-7.

data.evidence:
PAS = (A x 3.33 + B + C) / 3, where

  • A = Health Assessment Questionnaire Disability Index (HAQ-DI), calculated by averaging of the selected categorical scores* below.

  • B = Pain Visual Analog Scale (ask patient to rate pain on a scale of 0-10, where 10 is worst pain imaginable).

  • C = Patient Global Assessment of Disease Activity (ask patient to rate how well they are doing in the past week considering all the ways their disease affects them on a scale of 0-10, where 10 is the worst).

*Categorical score is the highest selected score within a given category. Example: If patient can self-dress without any difficulty but shampoos hair with much difficulty, the categorical score for dress and groom is 2.
